website_summaries.verdict: With its ability to stream hundreds of audio and video channels (including Netflix, Amazon, Vudu, and Hulu Plus), the $60 Roku HD would be our top pick for those seeking an ultra-affordable Internet media box -- if not for the fact that it's nearly identical to the slightly cheaper Roku LT.
pros: The Roku HD is a small streaming-media box that costs only $60
It offers hundreds of streaming-video and -audio services, including Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, HBO Go, Vudu, Pandora, Mog, Rdio, and MLB.TV
Roku also offers cross-platform search, capable of finding content across major streaming services
And the HD also supports older TVs via its analog video output
cons: For those invested in the Apple ecosystem, the Roku HD doesn't offer the same tight integration as the Apple TV's AirPlay functionality
The Roku HD also lacks channels for YouTube and Spotify
And there's no Ethernet port, so you'll need a solid Wi-Fi signal in your home theater

customer_reviews.title: BE WARNED:  Some Channels no longer work!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in Septermber 2012. Today, This is an OLDER UNIT and some channels are no longer available. Netflix is still available. Hulu is NOT available. (or does not work) I cannot recommend buying this unit today. Back in the day, is was great..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Blues

customer_reviews.title: 5 years ago and it still works like new. Updates are infrequent and occur in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing 2.5 years ago and it still works like new. Updates are infrequent and occur in the background, but as far as streaming devices go Roku is the way to go. I recently purchased a second Roku for our home, a Roku 3, after reading about how fast and smooth the operating system and apps all work, but I have yet to notice a perceptible difference in speed using one over the other. If you are looking to save a few dollars on a Roku, buying this model will provide a nearly identical experience to a newer one.
customer_reviews.author: scargums

customer_reviews.title: It's a Roku!
customer_reviews.text: What do you say? If it is a Roku it is good...I have the LT also and will go to the 3 if this ever wears out...It just keeps getting better with more programs and uses... Sure cut the cable... My only problem is I get so interested looking at all the possible programs I never get around to watching one! Easy to set up in minutes...works with almost any TV... They add on new programs weekly. Read the requirements first and compare to get the best fit for your TV...No tools or tech needed...just get one or several...
customer_reviews.author: Earthworks

customer_reviews.title: Great device for Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved my PC into the living room and tested it against the Roku HD on our 40 inch TV. The first two nights using the PC, the picture quality was poor, the size format was wrong, and during the movie Windows kept popping up and sometimes the screen went black. And then there's all the noise from the PC's fans and CPU. The next two nights, I moved the Roku from our bedroom to the living room, and the difference was amazing. The movies looked almost as good as satellite TV, the whole screen was filled, no interruptions from the system, totally quiet and smooth. We will definitely be getting another Roku for the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Titlelog

customer_reviews.title: Roku player is great
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this 3 stars because we were extremely disappointed in the shipper. We bought this for a vacation rental and before making the final order we thought it would arrive much sooner. Only after ordering it did they say it might take 2 -4 weeks to arrive. They apparently put it on a boat to Hawaii and it took the full 4 weeks. We needed to order another one through Amazon which only took 3 days to arrive. This one came after we left and we never actually got it but ended up giving it to someone there. I'm sure the Roku player itself is fine. We would have appreciated more accurate shipping times before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Russell

customer_reviews.title: Not as fancy as the newer Roku devices, but a good retrofit for old TVs
customer_reviews.text: This was a breeze to set up and hasn't had a single bug that I've encountered. My only complaint is that it doesn't seem to fit my TV screen dimensions quite right. No matter how I set it, it seems to distort the picture slightly by making it too narrow. It also seems to be slightly slower than the newer Roku devices. But this is definitely the way to go if you have an old TV that has composite inputs and you want to use it for streaming channels/services. Why send a good TV to the landfill if you can retrofit it with one of these?
customer_reviews.author: Atlas Moth

customer_reviews.title: Love Roku
customer_reviews.text: I only bought Roku to watch Netflix on TV after my son moved out and took his PS3 with him. Imagine my delight when I saw so many other free channels to watch!! And I have to check for new channels at least twice a week. It fits in the palm of my hand, so taking it with me to watch in bed is super simple. There may be a few areas a perfectionist would complaint about, but there's nothing about the Roku that would prevent me from buying another or recommending it to friends. It's the only way to watch TV for me. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Love our Roku!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device to get. We have this and it has worked wonderfully. We don't have cable and just have the subscriptions to Netflix and Hulu that are available on the Roku and it makes it so easy to watch our shows that way. It is easy to use. The remote is a small nice size and is easy to hold. I would recommend this for anyone that is thinking of getting one.
customer_reviews.author: lsp0605

customer_reviews.title: Cut the Cord, You Won't Be Sorry!
customer_reviews.text: We finally made the decision to cut the cord, subscribe to Hulu/Netflix and get a Roku to cut costs and save over $100 a month from just a typical cable plan with Internet. Saving over $1200 a year is nothing to scoff at. We now have only the internet and subscriptions. It is an adjustment at first getting rid of cable but we ALWAYS find something to watch. Roku essentially turns your TV into a smart TV. I like how you can use the Roku player to search by actor, TV show, or movie to find all available ways to watch. There are lots of ways to watch free shows on free Roku channels with some research and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: We love our Roku!
customer_reviews.text: We decided to give up Cable and get Roku and are saving so much money on Cable bills. Setting it up was a breeze. There are so many channels and new ones all the time, and we only pay for Netflix - we also watched our Amazon Videos through that channel until my Prime account expired. We will likely sign up for that again. You pay for what you want to, and there are numerous free channels. You definitely save lots over Cable if this is why you are getting the Roku. As for ditching cable, to balance this out we got an HD Antenna and we haven't missed Cable at all.
customer_reviews.author: ClaudiaLM

customer_reviews.title: Great little device!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these Roku boxes over the years - they are inexpensive gifts that are very well received. Note: an HDMI cable is NOT included in the box. Also, the device isn't 100% compatible with Logitech remotes, so be careful not to loose the original remote to preserve total functionality. Easy to setup, even for grandparents and tech-novice parents. Great gift for the individual who only wants to stream movies, and does not require any physical storage space on the unit. Should you require storage space, check out Western Digital WDTV - many of the same apps, but an option for storage and home networking.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I use it almost exclusively to stream Amazon Instant Video stuff (TV shows and movies that I've bought or through my Prime membership). That alone is worth it to me, because my only other previous option was attempting to use the AirPlay on my Apple TV, which was buggy through my iPad, or my PS3, which was a pain to turn on and log into just for that. So now this little device is very useful and intuitive to navigate. I'm just looking forward to the next time I buy a TV at this point so I can get a "smart" one with Amazon Instant Video connectivity already built in.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, then Buy an Amazon Prime Membership.  Buh-Bye Cable!
customer_reviews.text: We ditched cable and have been a Roku household for over a year. I've saved over a thousand dollars making the switch. You'll want one of these for each TV, and if you buy an Amazon Prime Membership, you get TONS of free shows and movies. You can buy on demand, and even buy digital copies of movies and TV shows. The kids can't lose or scratch DVD's anymore--we're all digital. My daughter went to a friend's house for a slumber party and brought the Roku with her. Within minutes, they were watching our family's movies, and we still had access to the library at home with a second device. Cable, it's not me, it's you.
customer_reviews.author: Jenburger

customer_reviews.title: Great box
customer_reviews.text: Got this deal at $40 with the holiday discount. No reason to go for the 1080p models unless you plan to use the ethernet port (which I always highly recommend) and have the bandwidth and applications to send such a high quality signal. Frankly this looks great on a 40'' TV over wireless. My girlfriend doesn't see any problems with the visual display and nor do I. Just wasting your money for 1080p if you're streaming over the internet most likely. Only local content sent that is actually 1080p resolution would display to the fullest. Save the money, go with the HD model.
customer_reviews.author: David Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up! It does come with the cords to connect with the tv ( the color coded, 3 prong type) , but I did order the HDMI cord which simplified set up even more. Glad I did. Just note: I originally bought this for a tv at work and with set-up on the computer it asks for a credit card for possible future purchases (games and stations that cost money). I called customer service and they were able to help me bypass this step since we only wanted free Pandora. So far at home, we use it for Netflix and Amazon movies, free if you already subscriptions.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not quite perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time, it works great. On rare occasions it will lose the streaming connection when the bandwidth is limited because of heavy network traffic. My only complaint is that on occasion, I will see a little pixelation in certain areas of dark scenes. I gave it 4 Stars instead of 5 Stars because it's not perfect, but it's pretty close considering all the problems that can be encountered when receiving content over the internet. I bought this particular model because it was rated higher than the more expensive Roku models by Amazon buyers. It works very well with Amazon Prime too.
customer_reviews.author: LC in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Great Little  Device.
customer_reviews.text: Much more entertainment that I was expecting.I was able to unsubscribe some Dish pay channels.The sound and picture quality is super(hdmi cable Roku to tv)I also installed Twonky Beam on my Xoom tablet ,now have hundreds of new channels,many are free,many more are added every day.YouTube Hollywood,Crakle,Movie Tube,Popcorn Flix,Pelicula Gratis, Netflix at about 7 bucks a month,Pandora,etc. etc.I can Twonky beam just about anything on YouTube,I can beam personal videos from gmail,tablet pc etc.etc.I'm very pleased so I just purchased the hd 2 xs top of the line model for another tv.It also has an a/v three wires(red ,white,yellow) hook up for older tv's.This thing is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: keeneye

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with my ROKU
customer_reviews.text: I read around online trying to decide between Roku and Apple TV, chose this Roku for my bedroom & may get a second for the living room. This is so much better than lying in bed with a hot laptop! I immediately associated my netflix, huluplus and amazon prime accounts with my Roku & set up a Plex account last night so I could watch movies I have saved on my laptop and stream online videos. I'm also surprised at the quality of the picture using only the component cable that came with the Roku. I have an older flat screen LCD tv in my bedroom and it doesn't have an HDMI input. Great invention!
customer_reviews.author: Turtlebeak

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The device works great. I mostly watch programming from Amazon Prime, but there are several other places to get programming, some free and some for a price. Some of the free programming includes advertisements, like what you would see if you were watching a commercial station. When you compare it to cable or satellite TV, you lose some programming choices, but on the other hand, look at the money you are saving. I use AT&T internet and they place bandwidth limits on my internet service, but so far, I've not even come close to the limit.
customer_reviews.author: Stan C

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's small connects to the network with ease. Streams pretty well. Cons: Even though you can watch free apps like Crackle you still have to subscribe to the apps like Netflix and HULU Plus and if you are a DirecTV subscriber you cannot use the HBO Go app. There is some legal BS that claims, even though you subscribe to HBO therefore you get HBO Go everywhere else You cannot get it if you are a DirecTV subscriber on Roku which makes no sense to me. So if you have a spare pc around you can pretty much do the same stuff with it and more then a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: iAmGonzo

customer_reviews.title: Movies
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing the Roku and joining Amazon Prime was a great money saver for me. The Roku was easy to install, even for me being tech. Illiterate. It's very easy to use and I have easy access to movies and television programs. One suggestion, even if you have HDTV you may not be able to use HDMI cable because of your particular television and will use RCA cables. The picture is great with RCA cables. Another suggestion, when prompted by Roku to access Amazon for code be sure to use http:/, makes it much easier. Roku has much more to offer than using only one provider , such as Netflix, Amazon Prime is much better for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: I love roku
customer_reviews.text: I had this unit for awhile and my mom was begging for something so she could watch her netflix on the big tv in her living room, so I gave her mine . I then realized I missed mine. I thought about getting the roku 3 but I really didn't need all those bells and whistles. I have netflix, amazon prime and Hulu (off my brothers account....shhhhh). I'm a night shifter so that's when nothing is ever good on except infomercials. With this I jus switch it over and watch away. I think eventually I'm jus going to drop the cable and stay with the free antenna and use my roku! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: rassccal

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: Since I don't have an Internet ready TV (yet) this was a nice gadget. It does hang up a bit. Enough to make me frustrated. I have to get up to disconnect the power for a few seconds then plug it back in. And the response time is slow. Don't know if that's the Roku's fault or my Internet signal. Its tiny. It just hides among the other components. The only thing you see is a tiny blue light. There's an updated, improved Roku available now so don't waste money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have cable or even network TV. I spend most of my time online, mostly Facebook. But on the weekend when my stepkids are here, they want to watch TV. So I got a Roku and a Netflix account. It's easy for them to use and I love not having a monthly fee. I use it for Pandora a lot too. I've only used the Roku exclusive "channels" a little bit but some of them seem pretty cool. And free! I'm probably going to buy another one for the bedroom. Although, it's really easy to move around from TV to TV once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my older television without cable.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for older TVs. Granted this box is an older model but I have had no problems with the performance. It streams the material I enjoy most on a TV I use on occasions that does not have cable connected to it. Very pleased and also like the vintage look of the box and the start up on screen logo.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Very cool.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got went belly up very quickly, but the newer one I got has been great ever since. Content is still a bit random and sparse. Netflix is fantastic and I expect that Hulu is as well. Other stations are hit and miss. WSJ is pretty good, but you have to watch the same ad repeatly. However, the content is not the product here. The product works very well especially for the cost. I bought a second one for my workout area. You should get one!
customer_reviews.author: D. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Roku HD after hearing about it from my husband's friend. I was looking for a way for my husband to enjoy movies without the high cost of cable movie channels or the inconvience of remembering to return movie rentals (I loathe remembering to return movies!!!!). I was totally ignorant of these devices. Being an electronics klutz I was very apprehensive about puchasing. But it was very simple to set up and activate. It asked for a credit card but I added my debit card along with a strong password code. My son plans to connect it to his Netflix account, so there should be enough movies to watch. Now to downgrade my cable subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have apple tv on a very new tv with HDMI inputs. My big screen tv doesn't have HDMI so I couldn't use apple tv. This ROKU allows me to connect it using component inputs. The picture is very good. If I replace the TV I will also be able to use the ROKU with an HDMI connection because it has both outputs. The remote is much better than the apple remote. The apple remote has a very short range. I often have to lean forward to get it to work. I usually use the remote app on my phone because of this problem. The ROKU was also about half the price of apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: Larrue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Worked fine for years. Never a problem. Only stopped using because someone else in the house wanted Apple TV. This is probably outdated now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth E.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Being new to the internet based video streaming, i thought that testing the waters as it were with this device would be a good introduction. Except for the somewhat clunky remote and non-qwerty on screen keyboard I LOVE this. I have more video entertainment than I can ever watch through all the various channels. Some that are subscription based but there are some that are free. This is a good way to introduce yourself into the on demand internet streaming video realm. The only other draw back is that there isn't an official channel that would allow me to watch shows from certain media network based websites.
customer_reviews.author: JustaDudeTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great device for internet streaming
customer_reviews.text: I do love using my Roku. It is now a household stable for streaming content. We long ago eliminated our cable/satelite TV subscriptions and this device really helps ease the void left by that choice. Pros: Has netflix Streams Amazon Prime Large number of streaming apps gives significant content (some are actually free) Cons: The device is a bit slow responding to commands. Does not work for streaming content from our network hard drive. We have to use a separate device for that. No Youtube app that I know of.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cried

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for the Roku for over a year before I finally purchased for myself. I have standard dsl so was a little worried that it would not stream well. I was also worried that it would overheat based on an earlier review. I was pleasantly surprised! I rarely encounter buffering problems. It does not overheat. There is no on/off feature, but it goes to "sleep/standby" with inactivity. I have touched it throughout the day and it is barely warm. It was also very easy to set up and register. I was pleasantly surprised by the number of free channels and free movies. The Roku has paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Tammey B.

customer_reviews.title: Newer Rokus not as good a quality as the older ones.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our first Roku about 9 years ago. Worked flawlessly. That one finally died, we replaced with a new one and added an additional unit for our bedroom TV. (We don't do cable, satellite or broadcast TV and don't miss it one bit.) The newer models of Roku just don't work as flawlessly as the original purchase. They must be rebooted frequently and movies tend to lag or take forever to load. This is a good product that the manufacturer has gotten sloppy with. Changing to Google Chrome when these two Roku's die.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Cable?  What cable?:)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electronic purchase I made in years. I have all my favorite channels, Netflix, Amazon, BBC, etc. all in one place, on one screen. I don't have to fumble through countless DVDs, it's all there. The machine is easy to install and the remote control took me 10 minutes to program. For a technically non-savvy person, Roku Player is a goldmine. It is very easy to use as well, even my child can do it by himself and choose his kid-related programs and cartoons. I only wish it would come with an extra remote control, as I tend to lose mine all the time:)
customer_reviews.author: Tatyana

customer_reviews.title: Supplements my tv greatly
customer_reviews.text: I watch a lot of Netflix so this is perfect. Easy to plug in and ready to go. Setup was easy. One minor problem is that my TV does not have A/V in (Component only) so my only option was HDMI. That's fine since I wanted to do HDMI anyways but unfortunately it doesn't come with an HDMI cord. FYI, I bought this for about $40. I may consider paying $50. Oh, and it's nice to browse the other services to see what they have to offer. Pandora is nice and Crackle actually has a couple of interesting movies that Netflix didn't have for stream.
customer_reviews.author: bochu

customer_reviews.title: Just say NO to cable bills!
customer_reviews.text: I was uneasy about this item when my husband suggested it. I liked the convenience of cable with a DVR & having the ability to watch shows/movies on my own schedule. We got a roku and learned to use it. We have now shut off the cable completely! Cable bill WAS $120 per month (internet not included). Now: even with us renting/purchasing ANY show we want off Amazon and the low subscriptions of Hulu and netflix our "cable bill" is less than $30 a month! Love that!!! Down sides: some shows are not on hulu or netflix. I have learned that I DO NOT miss those shows $120 worth!
customer_reviews.author: RanayRN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, better to access Netflix and Pandora
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little inexpensive tool to use rather than your personal computer with your TV. It is fast and easy to access two of the most popular streaming sites of netflix and pandora, only draw back is I can not access Youtube. But very interesting channels and a great replacement when there is nothing on tv or you need a movie/date night quick and simple. Great investment since there is no reoccuring charges, only your own subscription and this one time charge, I'd pay the subscriptions anyway so why not use a fun and easy tool to access the applications!
customer_reviews.author: JLAMPDAZME

customer_reviews.title: An excellent device.
customer_reviews.text: This player works fine for me. The wireless connection works perfectly with a Belkin Share router on the first floor that supports the 802.11n wireless specification. I use it with a Sharp 37 inch TV on the second floor with 1080i/720p so I don't need the 1080p capability. It was very easy to setup and I prefer to use the Roku app on my Kindle Fire to control the channel selection and the selection of Videos from Amazon Prime instant videos. I did put quarter inch spacers on the bottom of the device because the reported heating problem. However, it does not run warm at all even without the spacers.
customer_reviews.author: Evan T. Hazelton

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Freezes!
customer_reviews.text: When this device works it is very good, albeit a bit slow to respond. However, the big problem is that it freezes up almost every time I use it, sometimes within minutes of starting a program. When it freezes up, it usually requires a reboot before it will start working again. This takes maybe 10 minutes. Ruins the mood, for sure. I have not been able to find any cause or solution for the freezing issue. The device doesn't come with any troubleshooting information and I can't find anything on line either. Very disappointed with a promising product.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device out there.
customer_reviews.text: The best streaming device out there(minus the Roku 3). I have an Apple TV and when i bought this for my wife i ended up liking it a LOT more. it is just as fast and has several features that the Apple tv simply does not have. I like this remote better than the roku 3 remote though. Unlike the apple TV, it remembers where you left off, continues episodes to the nextone once you watch to the end. The interface is awesome and it is a great device, better than the interface on my tv, or bluray player, xbox or ps3.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, can be glitchy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 5 months. It's great as it's a cheap streaming box and has a good variety of channels, but I've found it to be glitchy. Frequently when I open certain channels, it will open in just about 1/3 of my screen and not function properly, so I'll have to go back to the home page and reopen it. Channels can be a bit slow to open at times as well. The streaming quality is great, and overall I am satisfied with the purchase, but I would probably consider a different model or an Apple TV instead.
customer_reviews.author: Peel

customer_reviews.title: Great little box
customer_reviews.text: We've been using our PS3 for our main TV and purchased the Roku so we could watch Netflix on the TV in our bedroom. Setup was a snap - got it hooked to the TV, on our wireless and linked to our Netflix and Amazon accounts in no time. Great picture quality and a nice clean interface. Installed Plex media server on our PC so we could stream videos from the hard drive there, that works exceptionally well (automatically loads movie posters and metadata for the movies and TV shows). Will be picking up a second one soon to use in the living room instead of the PS3 for streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good value and works well
customer_reviews.text: I live in teh sticks where cable is not available. We got by for quite a while on broadcast TV and that was pretty good but not great. As soon as we got a reasonable fast internet connection (1.5 meg) I joined Netflix and started streaming on an x-box. A month later, the x-box wanted 50 bucks to keep streaming and another 50 or so every year after that. I spent that much on this Roku and don't have any subscription fees. The interface is very intuitive. There are very few buttons, but it doesn't seem like a chore to work through the menus at all.
customer_reviews.author: Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: Product works great HOWEVER! Internet Resource Hog.
customer_reviews.text: Users be aware that the product Is a great internet resource Hog. Router : Linksys N600 EA2700-CA Laptops: 1 Connecting slow limited connection Phones: 2 Phones 1 phone connects the other gets connected but internet problems. TV with WiFi: No connection to WiFi no router visible. 20 ft away in bedroom Nintendo Wii: connects to internet but disconnects after every 5 minutes. Roku: working great Hogging the internet with its Sweet looking 720p resolution. Watching breaking bad or walking dead looks great.
customer_reviews.author: dre

customer_reviews.title: I have an Apple Tv and this Roku media player ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an Apple Tv and this Roku media player by far outperforma it. The applications interface is so much user friendly and aesthetically pleasing than the Apple Tvs. It seems as if Apple purposely does this so that you can use their Itunes service. This is especially true for the Netflix movie tiles. Very simple set up. Havent had any issues since purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is okay, but get a newer model
customer_reviews.text: Our internet is so bad that we can't use it to stream anything unless everyone is logged off. This isn't the fault of the device. It doesn't have a port to hook up a cable so it has to be used for streaming, which in our situation is not good. The purple button in the center of the remote fell out, so that may indicate poor quality. I am neutral on whether to recommend it or not... Maybe the newer ones are better.
customer_reviews.author: KoolKat007

customer_reviews.title: The cutest little piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I had been trying, for a long time, to figure out how to hook up my computer to my t.v. so I could watch Netflix -- to no avail. Then my son and I were talking about it and he suggested Roku (which means "6" in Japanese - for the 6 companies they have built). I bought it that night, it came really quickly and packaged very well. It was SO easy to set up and now I've been enjoying the results all week. Wow! This is a great buy. I was going to buy the t.v. package that had my channel in it for cable, but with this, I get so much more! And Netflix is only $8.00/month.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Barnat

customer_reviews.title: Kiss cable goodbye!
customer_reviews.text: For a one-time cost of about $60, I have all of the television shows I could ever watch, plus more. Yes, there are some channels like Redbox or Hulu that require a subscription. But $8 per month for a NetFlix subscription is still a heck of a lot less expensive than $100+ per month for cable. And there are hundreds of channels (and shows) that are entirely free. It was easy to connect. Took me all of about a whopping 5 minutes from the time I opened the box until I was watching.
customer_reviews.author: SnoBunny

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma, I'm streaming video!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Amazon Prime membership for a few years now and knew that I could use it to watch movies and TV shows on my computer, which I have done, enjoying the many free selections. Recently I decided I wanted to watch these videos on my TV, and I purchased the Roku HD, hooked it up this weekend, and the video streaming commenced! The setup was very easy, just had to pair the Roku to my wireless router, register at Roku and at Amazon, and then I was on my way. The picture quality is excellent. I am VERY happy with this purchase and look forward to many hours of steaming pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Gisele F. Dubson

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, missing common features
customer_reviews.text: The Roku HD is small and offers several choices for content. It is also easy to set up and use. I use it mainly for the Netflix app in the master bedroom. Therein lies a major flaw which costs them a star - and may have caused me to rethink the purchase. When I watch a series, it does not automatically carry on to the next episode. This small distinction makes it more cumbersome to use than the Netflix app on xbox 360, xbox one or ps3. It may seem negligible, but when I have to reach across my wife to grab the remote every 22 minutes, it becomes an issue. PLEASE update the app for binge watchers. Please!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A Zirbel

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat Roku...love it
customer_reviews.text: Still using it.....works good for me....I think the key is to make sure you have a good wi-fi unit...I upgrade mine to a net gear 600..I'm not a techy person....I could still use a better wi-fii for better coverage around the house....but it is good for now..You might as well but the newest version for Roku....they say it is 5 times faster....We ditched Direct TV...and we never missed a beat...saving 100.00 a month minus netflix and huluplus...80.00...bought a DVR and outside antenna...
customer_reviews.author: terribob

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Roku so much that I now own two. One is in our living room and the other is in my 2 yr old son's room. My son doesn't quite understand the concept of commercials and when he watches a tv show and it goes to commercial he swears up and down that I changed the channel and he gets mad. The roku has made life so much easier. He watches all his cartoons on Netflix with this device. We never have to worry about commercials and he can even work this device. It is absolutely perfect and works better than I thought it would. I recommend this product, especially to those with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Helpfulreviews

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Cut down my cable bill
customer_reviews.text: I got this since I realize I primarily watch certain shows on local TV and cable movie channels so I cut down on a lot of my cable bill and started streaming through Amazon Prime, HBOGo and Netflix. I decided on this Roku vs the more expensive version with 1080p and USB port because my TV is only 720p anyway and there's an app/channel you can add to Roku called Plex that allows you to stream videos from your computer. I chose this over Apple TV since I preferred the compatibility with Prime and HBOGo. Also the prices to rent and buy on Prime seemed a bit cheaper than ITunes.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Very simple.
customer_reviews.text: We had the Sony streaming player. BUT, I washed the remote which then made the streamer useless. I also did not like the Sony because all the menus were tiny. When watching on our 32 inch tv in the bedroom, couldn't see the details in the menu. This Roku has beautiful, large menus. The remote is so simple you can use it in the dark. It does not run as flawlessly as the Sony did, but for all its other conveniences it is worth it. And if you lose the remote, you can buy another one fairly cheap. I definitely recommend it over the Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Nixon72

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to family since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: This device is so cool...simplistic in design, installation and usage. It takes about a minute to install appropriately whereby you are ready to stream videos and such offline. Has hundreds of channels that you can choose to add and use. So many free channels with bunches of great movies to choose from. I should have bought this device years ago. I simply cannot believe the number of movies, hunting shows, sportsman related channels, etc; that I now have access to with the push of a button which are free. It is so cool and nice to have this new addition to the family.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Roku is great no matter which model you get, but be selective nevertheless!
customer_reviews.text: This review is somewhat dated as this item has been replaced. However I just wanted to add my two cents and say that Roku rocks! This model and it's newer replacement are lower on the Roku chain but they are still nice items. That being said if I was going for a basic Roku for a situation that didn't require 1080p I would probably just buy the Roku LT which is still the best streaming value on the market! If you want full HD and more features go with the newer Roku 3.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gahler

customer_reviews.title: Best product for tv internet streaming!
customer_reviews.text: With the purchase of 2 roku's I was able to ditch my $200 plus monthly cable bill. I am so tired of paying hundreds of dollars a month for cable. It is a bit of an adjustment, but with Amazon prime and the free Roku channels it has been fairly painless. I now just pay for internet, amazon prime (which roughly averages $7 a month), and GAIAM tv for work outs($10 a month). I am saving over $100 a month. The Roku itself is great, and you can get an app to use your phone as a remote. My only complaint is that the Roku does not have an off button- seems wasteful. I just unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy one of these long ago?!
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at how tiny this thing is and how easy it is to install. Does NOT come with an HDMI cable but did come with AV cables. Netflix, Amazon Prime, HULU Plus, VUDU...all the accounts we use and so many more are available. Had just bought two blu ray players and didn't realize I did not get the wifi versions...buying two Roku units was cheaper than buying the wifi dongle and offered us WAY more channel options. Wish I had done this when they first came out! What a bargain...can see how people are using these to ditch cable and satellite now!
customer_reviews.author: biglove

customer_reviews.title: Such an improvement over the older model I had.
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this purchase. I like that it is more "user friendly" than the older version I had and I also like the way I can organize the shows I especially like to watch. I just wish Hulu would get their servers to work well on a consistent basis. I often get a message that they are experiencing problems with their servers. Unplugging the device and restarting fixes the problem, but is annoying when it happens in the middle of a show! But the Roku itself is just terrific and I am so happy that I upgraded!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Elliott

customer_reviews.title: I love love love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly to stream Netflix but there are a lot of other applications to use. At this price it is the best option if you are just needing to stream netflix and do not use a DVD player. The other applications are to watch stored news programs from the day. Check up on sports scores and highlights. You can very inexpensively subscribe to special interest channels such as cooking shows, religious shows, gay themed stations and of course a lot of applications to stream music and radio content to you TV. I love my Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Keith P in ABQ

customer_reviews.title: Should you love an appliance?
customer_reviews.text: Cancelled netflix when they increased the fees. Missed it. I love this replacement. I rent movies off vudu (brand new releases - same day store gets them) and amazon. Also, I can watch any dvd's I bought at amazon that had the additional digital version included. It is really easy - my husband is uncomfortable with a lot of computer things - but he can do it. I love renting a new release on Friday night - watching it again Saturday if I really liked it (24 hr rental) - and having nothing to return. Doesn't get any better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative to cable
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get Roku to use with my Amazon Prime membership. I enjoy the fact that I can wach movies on my television in addition to my Kindle Fire. Tried one of the free channels and was upset with the fact that it would freeze, then show an advertisement and then go back to the movie I was watching. This happen three times in a matter of 30 minutes. Don't know if this happens with the other free channels as I have not tried them out. Love that you can access other options such as Netflix and you have music channels. The Roku is great to have for lazy weekends.
customer_reviews.author: Prestige

customer_reviews.title: hated it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Roku and both are always cutting off in the middle of the movie or whatever I am watching, I thought it was the Router, however my Wii nerver cuts out or my son't Xbox. If I go and redo the router my son goes beserk because I undid his xbox while he's playing online with whoever and the Wii shuts off and whoever is doing the dances or whatever is going carzy, so now I just unplug the Roku. A waste!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Roku changed my life
customer_reviews.text: I love roku. I can get Hulu and Netflix plus many many more channels to any tv in my house. There is no monthly fee which is better. The best part about Roku is for me i told my cable company to go scratch!! Now i don,t have to listen to stupid commercials and i don,t have to listen to my cable company and Viacom argue over what channels iam going to loose. Plus i don,t have to pay direct tv the insane price of 120$ monthly for basic cable and 60 channels of sales pitches. I love roku it changed my life
customer_reviews.author: LordMetalZ28

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Dream
customer_reviews.text: This product works wonderfully. The only issue I ever had is that the remote kinda has to be in a certain distance to be able to send a signal to the ROKU. I havent had any issues with the product overheating or glitching. Streams Pandora and Netflix perfectly no issues. I do wish the device came with some kind of hook on the back to be able to hook up on the wall or some 2 sided tape to stick on the back TV but it's fine as it is sitting on the table next to the TV. The device also doesn't come with an HDMI cable so you have to buy one separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Of Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd purchased sooner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first streaming Blue Ray player a couple of years ago and thought it was pretty cool to stream Netflix. At that time a Roku box cost about as much as the Blue Ray player, so I opted to purchase a BR Player. At the same time, I wanted the increased versatility that Roku (and some other boxes provide). Purchased this as a gold box deal and truly, it is a great value. I don't have the fastest network (old "G" wireless router), but the Roku has streamed flawlessly. Highly recommend and I really like this little box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mcerlain

customer_reviews.title: Love the device, hate Roku's required registration process
customer_reviews.text: I knocked off two stars because Roku now requires you to sign up on their website during the activation process. They also *require* credit card info; you can't activate without supplying them with payment information for potential purchases. This is my 2nd Roku; I've never purchased content. I should knock off more stars because I dislike being forced to do such things. The product itself is what you'd expect, if you've ever used a content streaming device. Netflix, Amazon Prime, and many others are all available.
customer_reviews.author: Darrick Webster

customer_reviews.title: great product, very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: We do not have cable tv. This Roku allows us to watch movies and tv series whenever we wish. It now works with Vudu as well as Netflix , Hulu, Amazon and Pandora. There are also news channels and sports channels and a free movie channel called Crackle. It was so easy to setup, I didnt need any help and I am a little short of being a technical wizard. It was pretty much just plug it in and find your channels. Typing on the keyboard is tedious, but you only need to do it once for each new setup. It was really money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a great device!
customer_reviews.text: This is so great and with the sale price, even better. I bought the LT for my home, and then bought this one for an xmas gift for my in-laws. I'm sure they will love it. Right now they order netflix dvds but were talking about how they would really lie to be able to watch the streamed movie on their t.v. rather than their computer. This is the perfect device for that. Now they can start enjoying all of their netflix account AND other great apps as well!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: "Yeah, It's 'Old'. So What?!"...
customer_reviews.text: Added the ROKU HD PLAYER back in January 2013, and have never had any problems w/ it. Use it to watch everything from old, free, public domain movies, to YOU TUBE videos, to AMAZON PRIME. After giving up on cable / satellite TV, we found that we didn't miss it. ROKU is a nice addition to our cheap TV arsenal...
customer_reviews.author: Bindy Sue Frønkünschtein

customer_reviews.title: Then it works fine. Doesn't happen too much though
customer_reviews.text: Works realy well with the exception of it freezing up. The. I have to unplug and plug back in to reset it. Then it works fine. Doesn't happen too much though.
customer_reviews.author: rjh

customer_reviews.title: Works great & simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this to attach to a new Samsung TV in my bedroom. It was super easy to set up. It provides a huge selection of streaming programs. Very easy to use. I like that Netflix via the ROKU has a search feature (my Blu-ray player that I stream Netflix from in my living room does not have a search function). Sometimes I lose my connection. I think it is the ROKU, since my other wireless computers and devices in my house have no issue. All in all it is a great and inexpensive way to get streaming media.
customer_reviews.author: AliCat

customer_reviews.title: Roku
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I was very skeptical at first, worrying whether my credit card would be charged for movies i didn't authorize. I know it sounds funny, but i was concerned about it. I understand how this works and i like it a lot. I use amazon prime shipping now that I bought the package that this came with. I had to buy the controller box and remote separately, but i still think it is a good value. We cut cable and have been going to the public library to check out dvd's, It is hard to find good ones. This makes it convenient and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Yoga AddictTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roku. I bought it 2 years ago and didn't like the interface, so gave it to a friend. I bought it again, mainly for HULU plus and AMAZON. The device freezes after few hours of watching movies, You have to power off and restart again. Sometime, the search just hangs for no reason. These days we power off this device every two days, so that it won't freeze in the middle of a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I also purchased the HDMI cable to go with it (only about 8 bucks) Its puts out a very clear picture The remote is very user friendly and easy to use (unlike another cheaper brands streaming device that we started with and returned only because of how bad the remote was) it comes with the remote and batteries, and the red, yellow, white cord so you can plug in to any TV (even my boys's super old big boxy one) it doesnt come with the HDMI cable, but there getting pretty cheap Overall I completely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku HD Streaming Player
customer_reviews.text: I really like this device, it works great and has given us hours of quality programs. We watch the religious station 3ABN and find the very best of true biblical based programming. The only thing I would change on the Roku is add a manual on/off switch with auto shut of in case user forgot to turn the player off. The reason for this is I have waited for 5 or more minutes after turning TV off only to discover the LED is still on the Roku. It is a bargain for this much entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: jimbid

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have become very attached to my Roku as it is so much faster to download movies than my blue ray dvd player with internet capabilities. I enjoy Netflix very much (the best buy on TV Entertainment) and Roku makes it easy. I do wish they had an optical sound output for my dolby system. I dont like running the picture through the amp, as I think it reduces picture quality, plus you have to have a big tuner on all the time, not just when you want to watch a good movie. Overalll, a good product and the price was good, compared to local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: When it works I like it a lot. However, every couple of weeks it just can't find the network for a few days. It's not the network - everything else (including apple tv in the other room) still work fine. After I reset it a few times and let it sit for awhile it will eventually start working again. It's annoying to sit in front of my TV w/roku and watch movies on my laptop using the very network roku can't locate. While I am happy with my apple tv, I bought a roku because I wanted Amazon Prime Video. And I wanted to pay half as much. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: psatty

customer_reviews.title: Kill Cable for good
customer_reviews.text: If you have Roku and PlayOn TV, there is no need for cable. This is the second box I've purchased for my home. This one is for my 5 yr old who has no problems working the simple remote and app based screen. She loves watching Netflix and PBS Kids on her tv. Through PlayItOn tv, i can watch any show that comes online from all the major networks so i never miss anything (one time fee of $40 for lifetime membership). The only bill I pay is $9 a month to netflix. Highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I purchased this device I've felt no need to watch commercial tv. My Netflix, Amazon Prime and Pandora are all linked and ready to stream at the push of a button. before I had the Roku I used to watch Amazon movies on my Kindle now I can enjoy my umlimited streaming on my 32inch tv. If you have Amazon Prime and you dont have a smart tv this is the perfect device for you. just make sure your tv has an HDMI port and you'll also need to buy the HDMI cable because it doesnt come in the box. Amazon also sells the HDMI cable for a lot cheaper than most places.
customer_reviews.author: Tisha

customer_reviews.title: Adds even more content
customer_reviews.text: I got this even though I already have an Apple TV. It works beautifully and there is tons of content - most of which I don't use! In general, the Apple TV's interface is nicer and the experience just seems much higher quality than the Roku. I don't regret buying the Roku - especially for use with Amazon Prime videos, since Amazon is not and probably never will be available on Apple TV. So for that alone, for me, it was worth it. It (the Roku) is a very easy to use, high quality product that has been very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Will

customer_reviews.title: The best invention
customer_reviews.text: I bought the very first HD available as soon as it was available, and I have not looked back. I no longer watch hours of commercials, just hours of the TV and Movies I love, uninterrupted. While this newer model(that updates itself) is sleek and has a snazzy interface, it is actually slower than the original model(which is a minor issue that I can live with). I'm thrilled that I now can watch PBS, and could go on singing the praises of this wee little plastic encased computer chip that has revolutionized my old, tired tube tv.
customer_reviews.author: kalliope james

customer_reviews.title: What took me so long?
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been toying with getting a ROKU and I have no idea why it took me so long to do. This holiday season I purchased this model at a great price during one of Amazon's lightening deals. I am so glad I did. Set-up was super easy - seriously, plug and play. Switched TV to the right input and it detected my wireless (3 stories below) with no problems. I have had no problems with reception and love the amazon prime benefits. Plan to get another for our main TV. Between this and Netflix through my WII I am about to drop cable.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Roku
customer_reviews.text: Was able to cut the cord due to the Roku and save $90 a month. Has every thing I need and is easy to use and set up with the HDMI cable. Highly recommend it. Not sure if it would be good for sport lovers, but fits my needs as I mostly watch tv shows. I subscribe to Netflix and Hulu for $15 a month and am all set. Does not run hot. Tiny but powerful. It also syncs with your computer for streaming movies and pics that you have in your library. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Roku
customer_reviews.text: This is really a money saver! Got Roku, set up took about 15 minutes (would have been less time, but my 7 year old was doing the set up). Got rid of both HBO and no longer buy on-demand from the cable company. These two savings average about $24 / month ($16 for HBO and two on-demand movies for $4 each). Just be careful about signing up for what looks like it's free, but really is not -- "free for 30 days" "free trial" "free movies" etc.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great Device for Streaming Content to your TV
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Roku as the first bit the dust (I will have to down grade the rating on this one if it only makes it a year like our last one). The menu's and interfaces are easy to use and the device gives you access to a plethora of content, our favorite is the Amazon Prime Content of course... but there is so much available we decided we did not need to add an additional dish receiver to our bedroom since our Roku provides us with more than enough content to stay entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Catalicious

customer_reviews.title: Super easy way to get streaming content
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool way to get at pay service like Netflix, amazon, and hulu. However, content is pretty stale. It does predict some of the content based on what you already watched. I like the fact you can access Facebook photos on you TV. The one thing to consider is how fast is your wireless? On Facebook it doesn't play my video well so I wish I'd gotten the one with Ethernet port. On any streaming content from Netflix works fine. Think I'd look for a device that also let's you surf web instead of just subscription content.
customer_reviews.author: CraigB703

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I just received by Roku HD yesterday and I love it. I cannot think of another device that costs so little and delivers so much. I also bought an inexpensive HDMI cable and connected the Roku to my TV by HDMI. It took maybe 15 minutes to connect the Roku, register online and link it to my Amazon videos account. Last night, I was watching one of my Amazon videos on my big screen TV. You also can watch videos from many other sources besides Amazon using the Roku. What a device!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Beadles

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roku player! I mostly use it for HD streaming from my Netflix and Amazon Prime accounts directly on my tv, but there are lots of great free channels also available. If you want to really get the most out of it I would recommend buying a separate HDMI cable to connect it to your tv. The only cable it comes with is standard AV, which will not transmit an HD picture to your tv. Other than that it comes with everything you need to use the player. The setup is extremely simple and fast and I had it up and running in just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Manda

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an earlier model Roku and have to say that I'm very happy with the upgrade. The picture is wonderful; likewise, the sound is great. There are some slight tweaks in the UI that I think are successful, particularly the addition of a "back" button on the remote. My one complaint is that I had to log-in to all my services individually despite having a Roku account. I'd love to be able to sync my Roku account with Hulu, Amazon Prime, Netflix, Pandora, etc on the web and then avoid the tedious "typing in" of my email address and passwords for each service using my TV and Roku remote.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Hodder

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Deal for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I am not a tech guru, but for what I wanted (streaming music and movies), this little device packs quite a punch for the buck! The only drawback is that it does not have access to Youtube. One small thing for what it DOES do. I have bought other streaming devices before, and they had all tended to "buffer" or stopped playback to load. So far my Roku has not. And I like that. So, I'll stick to my computer for Youtube, and let Roku deliver amazing video quality on my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Smart TV?
customer_reviews.text: Why would you need to spend a premium on a "smart tv" when you can add or remove components that make it "smartER"? These ROKU's are awesome and give you so much in such a tiny little box. Bought this for my spare bedroom in my house and the only complaint I have is that the setup takes kind of longer than I anticipated. Works great regardless of the setup and I'm just used to much quicker plug and play immediately type tech. Buy this you won't be disappointed. PS- My TV in the spare room is only capable of 1080i at the highest.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Regalado

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could watch netflix while typing my midterms for grad school. It wasn't hard to set up, but it does drop the wireless signal on a regular basis. That means I have to click around and restart what I was watching; if I were watching a movie or something I cared about, the constant signal dropping would drive me insane. But, since I am not that invested in the bajillionth episode of whatever crappy show I am watching, I just find it tedious. Maybe you are both more patient and have better taste in brainless tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Aunt

customer_reviews.title: Very good for getting to my Netflix account
customer_reviews.text: This makes getting to my Netflix account easy and I don't have to put programs and movies on my queue from my computer. I can now go directly to my Roku and get to any of the TV shows or movies that I want. This is very good, but would be better if it didn't have to be lined up quite so much from remote to Roku box. That is the one reason I didn't give it the 5 stars. It is a great system otherwise. I have used this system for almost a month and have been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Roku - the next best thing?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool if you currently have service through Netflix and/or Hulu etc. There are lots of other channels, but sadly they either lack in content or they are also subscription services. Only have had a few instances of it seizing up and it may have been more related to Internet connectivity. If you are a gamer, considering the upgrade would be worth it because you can't buy this one and "upgrade" the console - you have to buy the next series up. Pretty good considering cost - wish they would get more sponsors to add channels and/or services.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I really love this thing. It's very easy to set up and use. I watch Hulu and Amazon Prime shows on it all the time. Browsing with the remote is kind of hard, but I just queue up things I'm interested in watching from my actual computer, then can go right to them on the Roku menu. I've cancelled my cable tv and just watch streaming video through Roku now. Even after the cost of the Roku and the subscription fees for Hulu and Amazon, I'm still saving a lot of money from what I was paying for cable tv.
customer_reviews.author: dhrachth

customer_reviews.title: An expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the price of the Roku HD, and as a Cyber Monday deal it was only $40. I had to return the first one because of a faulty HDMI port, but Amazon made that easy. The replacement worked for a while, but it just died one day. The power light didn't come on the the unit was basically a paperweight. Can't get it repaired and Roku didn't stand behind their poor engineering or subpar components. If a company doesn't have enough faith its its product to stand behind it, then it's best to look to another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: A simple alternative
customer_reviews.text: We had decided to get rid of cable. With three kids under 15, I was worried that they would go crazy. That has not been the case. There are many "channels" that are free that you can subscribe to. The kids are familiar with Netflix so they tend to stay on that channel, but there are many to choose from. There are kung-fu channels, western channels, a wide variety of free choices. So far we have not missed cable. Set up is easy and short using a home network. You do not even need to have HD as the Roku comes with the three colored cables. It is a cheaper, different, version of cable, without a monthly charge.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler S.

customer_reviews.title: Roku rocks my world
customer_reviews.text: I won't pay for cable as there's hardly a thing on it I want to watch. But I enjoy streaming movies and some TV shows. This device allows me to watch Netflix without burning out my laptop (which is how I was watching before) and view my Amazon Prime shows and best of all, rewatch any missed Downton Abbey episodes on the PBS channel. And there seem to be more streaming channels everyday! The only reason I don't give the Roku 5 stars in because of occasional freeze-ups, but those seem to have mostly stopped since the latest software update. I also wish their system of entering txt to search was less cumbersoome, but that is a minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: DeManda

customer_reviews.title: Buy it Now
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was one of those too good to be true products, I am glad I was wrong. I am going to buy one for each TV so they all sync. If you ever say nothing on TV to watch you are not looking hard enough. The product is easy to use and program. Most of the stations are free, some you pay a subscripton fee if you want it. There is enough free programing to watch so you don't have to pay for a channel. If you have good streaming to your computer you will not have a problem using your computer and the boxes at the same time. Well worth the money.

product_meta.title: Roku HD Streaming Player (Old Model)
product_meta.description:
The Roku HD delivers all the streaming entertainment choices, 720p HD video quality, and ease of use that Roku is known for, at an amazing price. Enjoy 600+ channels from all the top sources such as Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, Pandora, HBO GO and MLB. Includes one stop search. There’s even a free app for iOS and Android.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Roku HD streams 600+ channels to any TV easily and wirelessly, all at an amazing price. Features 720p HD video quality and one-stop search.


600+ channels and growing. Movies and TV shows from Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu Plus, VUDU, and HBO GO, plus live sports, music, news, international, and more, up to 720p HD.


Free movies! Includes hundreds of full-length Hollywood movies and TV series from Crackle -- all free and on-demand.


Best selection of live sports. Featuring MLB baseball, NHL hockey, NBA basketball, MLS soccer, and more.

One-stop search. Find your favorite movies and TV shows all from one place -- no matter if they're on Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, or Hulu Plus.


The easiest setup. Works with virtually any TV, includes built-in wireless, and sets up in minutes.

Free iOS and Android app. Use it like a remote. Browse and add new channels. Even stream your music and photos from your phone or tablet to your HDTV.

THE BEST IN MOVIES AND TV
Roku puts over 150,000 titles at your fingertips, including…

 * The biggest Netflix experience around, with support for HD video, Dolby Digital+ surround sound, and English subtitles.
 * Hulu Plus, with an amazing selection of current TV shows from the biggest networks.
 * Amazon Instant Video, featuring the latest movie releases, virtually all the blockbusters of the past, hit TV series, and much more—all on demand.
 * Hundreds of free Hollywood movies from Crackle.
 * Access to premium services like HBO GO and EPIX, available via participating providers. 

With Roku, you'll always find that perfect movie or show to fit your mood. 

PLUS EVEN MORE CHOICES
With over 600 entertainment channels and counting, there's something for virtually everyone, including…

 * Unlimited music from Pandora, MOG, Rdio, and Live365.
 * Live sports packages including NBA League Pass, NHL GameCenter Live, MLS Matchday, UFC, and MLB.TV.
 * Photo and video sharing via Facebook, Flickr, and Picasa.
 * The top news sources like NBC, FoxNews.com, and CNN.

Of course, there are also tons of international and lifestyle programming, tech news, social networking, podcasts, cartoons, clips, cat tricks, and... well, you get the idea. 

COMPARE ROKU MODELS




750+ entertainment channels Built-in wireless (Wi-Fi b/g/n compatible) New on-screen experience with one-stop search Plays 720p HD video* Instant replay control on remote Plays 1080p HD video* Remote with headphone jack (includes in-ear headphones) 

Motion control for games (Angry Birds Space included free) Dual-band wireless, Ethernet port & USB port** 

*Availability of 720p or 1080p HD video varies by entertainment channel


** See product description below for list of file formats supported via USB

***All Roku 2 models feature a MicroSD memory slot for additional storage capacity, plus Bluetooth for adding an RF remote control



IT'S RIDICULOUSLY EASY
From the simple remote to the easy-to-use interface, Roku was designed to please everyone. All you need to get started is a high-speed Internet connection (and a TV, of course). The built-in wireless and guided setup mean you can be up and running in minutes. And we bet you don't even have to call your nerdy nephew for help.

INCLUDED WITH THE ROKU HD
 * Remote control
 * Two AA batteries
 * HDMI video output (for high-definition)
 * Composite A/V combo output (for standard-definition; works with included A/V cable)
 * Wireless (Wi-Fi b/g/n)
 * A/V cable (red/white/yellow)
 * Power adapter
 * Get Started guide
 * 90-day manufacturer warranty

WHAT YOU NEED
 * A TV
 * High-speed Internet service with a speed of at least 1.2 Mbps (such as mid-level DSL). For HD video, 5 Mbps is recommended. 
 * A wireless router
